resources.string: Please tell us the result of your test
The information you provided suggests that you are not very susceptible to COVID-19. However, you should continue to follow all CDC recommendations.
Due to your %1$s, you are %2$s susceptible to the coronavirus.
Due to your %1$s, COVID-19 poses a life-threatening risk to you.
Please stay inside, practice social distancing, and remember to wash your hands regularly to prevent yourself from acquiring COVID-19.
Keep taking your medication as prescribed by your healthcare provider.
Continue to follow your Asthma Action Plan.
Keep taking prescribed diabetes pills and insulin and test your blood sugar every four hours. Make sure you have at least a two-week supply of your medication.
Do not miss your dialysis treatments and store enough food to follow your Emergency Diet Plan if maintaining your normal treatment schedule is not possible.
You are very likely to have COVID-19. We strongly suggest you get tested and distance yourself as much as possible from others.
You are likely to have COVID-19. We suggest you get tested for COVID-19.
You are at moderate risk of having COVID-19. We suggest you stay at home and distance yourself as much as possible from others.
You are not likely to have COVID-19. We still suggest that you avoid contacting others if possible.
You most likely do not have COVID-19. However, we still suggest that you practice good social distancing protocols.

Welcome to COVIDTracker, an app that tracks COVID-19 and attempts to calculate the percentage chance that you have contracted COVID-19 by analyzing the interactions youâ€™ve had with the people around you using Bluetooth data. All potential risk factors and information presented in this app are the result of thorough research from trusted sources such as the CDC and the Mayo Clinic. Using your personal information and medical history, the app will notify you of the risks involved in contracting COVID-19 so that you can stay safe and healthy, and reminds you to continue to practice proper social distancing protocols.\n\nCOVIDTracker was designed to be easy-to-use, simple, and elegant: that means no hassles, gotchas, or strings attached. The app collects Bluetooth data silently in the background, ensuring that you and the people in your community around you stay safe amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.

Before going out, make sure to check the app\'s map to see which areas of your community are most affected by the spread of COVID-19. Then, you can make an informed decision about which areas of your community are safe to travel to. Additionally, by swiping down on the map screen, you can view your risk of infection and see reminders to practice social distancing.

If you test positive for COVID-19, we recommend you notify us of your test result immediately through the app\'s test reporting system. When you inform us that you\'ve tested positive, our mathematical model will backtrack over all the interactions you\'ve had within two weeks of the test date in order to inform those around you of their risk of infection. Our model is reliant on your self-reported data: the sooner you report a positive test, the better.

Using Bluetooth data collected from your phone, COVIDTracker builds a network of interactions that you\'ve had with the people around you. As people in your community use the app, this network of interactions grows larger and larger, allowing us to generate a probability model that determines the likelihood that an infected person passed the disease along to you.

As this version of the app represents a prototype of how the app will really appear when fully functioning, there is currently no built-in online connectivity. For the moment, you have been assigned to a random user from a temporary database of users. This user\'s percentage has been calculated via the mathematical model described earlier by analyzing their interaction data with other random users.

You are currently using a mockup version of the app. This version represents what using the app might be like when fully released. Because this version lacks online-connectivity, it is using mockup data generated for the purposes of demonstrating the app. The current mockup database contains %1$d randomly generated users (%2$d of which are infected) and %3$d user-to-user interactions among these randomly-generated users. You are currently viewing the results of the mathematical model\'s calculations for random user %4$s %5$s. Click the button below to see the results for a different randomly-generated user in the database.
